newsitem.title: USA: Ariz. Palo Verde 1 nuclear unit seen up this week.
newsitem.headline: Ariz. Palo Verde 1 nuclear unit seen up this week.

text.p: Unit 1 at the Palo Verde nuclear generation station was expected to resume operation later this week from its refueling and maintenance outage, the plant's operator Arizona Public Service Co (APS) said Monday.
"We are expected to go on line later this week," said a company spokesman. "We completed the tasks with less time."
APS had anticipated the outage of the 1,221 megawatt (MW) unit to last 44 days from September 21.
"It's going to be closer to 40 days," the spokesman said.
The two neighboring units, each also at 1,221 MW, were operating at full output.

APS, a subsidiary of Pinnacle West Capital Corp, has a 29.1 percent interest in the Wintersburg, Ariz., nuclear plant. The company's stake in Palo Verde accounts for roughly 30 percent of its generation capacity.
Other owners include Edison International's Southern California Edison Co, El Paso Electric Co and Public Service Co of New Mexico.
